intro: Chilita wilcoxii, commonly known as the Wilcox's chilita, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique climate of Hawaii. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces yellow to orange blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
